TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit FeatureSupport extends System.Object implements class System.Windows.Forms.IFeatureSupport
Public MustInherit Class FeatureSupport Implements IFeatureSupport
public ref class FeatureSupport abstract : System::Windows::Forms::IFeatureSupport

Docs.summary: Provides methods for retrieving feature information from the current system.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the `static` methods of this class when the classes you query for feature information implement the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IFeatureSupport> interface. Otherwise, inherit from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FeatureSupport> and provide your own implementation. For an implementation of this class, see <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature>.
To get the version number of a feature, call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FeatureSupport.GetVersionPresent%2A>. Call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FeatureSupport.IsPresent%2A> to determine if a particular feature or version of a feature is installed.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature> implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FeatureSupport> and queries for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature.LayeredWindows> feature. The version is checked to see if it is `null`, to determine whether the feature is present. The result is displayed in a text box. This code assumes `textBox1` has been created and placed on a form.
[!code-cpp[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic OSFeature Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic OSFeature Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic OSFeature Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

block.para: When you inherit from , you must override the method. When you override this method, check that the class that you use for the parameter is the same as the class used for this parameter in the method. If the two parameters differ, you also must override .

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the version of the specified feature that is available on the system.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Version GetVersionPresent (object feature);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Version GetVersionPresent(object feature) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetVersionPresent (feature As Object) As Version
public: abstract Version ^ GetVersionPresent(System::Object ^ feature);
abstract member GetVersionPresent : obj -> Version

Docs.param: The feature whose version is requested.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the version of the specified feature that is available on the system.
Docs.returns: A representing the version number of the specified feature available on the system; or if the feature is not installed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Version numbers consist of three parts: major, minor, and build. Typically, a version number is displayed as "major number.minor number.build number".
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature> implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FeatureSupport> and queries for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature.LayeredWindows> feature. The version is checked to see if it is `null`, to determine whether the feature is present. The result is displayed in a text box. This code requires that `textBox1` has been created and placed on a form.
[!code-cpp[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic OSFeature Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic OSFeature Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic OSFeature Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static Version GetVersionPresent (string featureClassName, string featureConstName);

Docs.param: The fully qualified name of the class to query for information about the specified feature. This class must implement the interface or inherit from a class that implements this interface.
The fully qualified name of the feature to look for.
Docs.summary: Gets the version of the specified feature that is available on the system.
Docs.returns: A with the version number of the specified feature available on the system; or if the feature is not installed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Version numbers consist of three parts: major, minor, and build. Typically, a version number is displayed as "major number.minor number.build number".
See the documentation for the product containing the feature to determine the names to pass to the `featureClassName` and the `featureConstName` parameters.

Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified feature is installed in the system.

Docs.summary: Determines whether any version of the specified feature is installed in the system.
Docs.returns: if the feature is present; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature> implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FeatureSupport> and queries for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature.LayeredWindows> feature. The version is checked to see if it is `null`, to determine whether the feature is present. The result is displayed in a text box. This code requires that `textBox1` has been created and placed on a form.

Docs.param: A representing the minimum version number of the feature to look for.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified or newer version of the specified feature is installed in the system.
Docs.returns: if the feature is present and its version number is greater than or equal to the specified minimum version number; if the feature is not installed or its version number is below the specified minimum number.

Docs.param: The fully qualified name of the class to query for information about the specified feature. This class must implement the interface or inherit from a class that implements this interface.
The fully qualified name of the feature to look for.
Docs.summary: Determines whether any version of the specified feature is installed in the system. This method is .
Docs.returns: if the specified feature is present; if the specified feature is not present or if the product containing the feature is not installed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See the documentation for the product containing the feature to determine the names to pass to the `featureClassName` and the `featureConstName` parameters.
